Host Club del Instituto Ouran
Хост-клуб Оранской школы
نادي مدرسة أوران الثانوية للضيافة
מועדון האירוח של תיכון אורן
Ouran Lisesi Host Kulübü
Ouran Koukou Host Bu

similaranime.anime: Ore ga Ojou-sama Gakkou ni "Shomin Sample" Toshite Gets-sareta Ken

recommendations.recommendation: great quality!
A very enjoyable comedy about romance with funny and lovable characters, very recommended if you want a good laugh
Definitely an all-tine favorite of mine! A funny, light shoujo romance!
watched this with Quynh. Miss u.
Really fun and entertaining, seen it 3-4 times and It`s just really really good. Well recommended!
A masterpiece of moe that deconstructs moe itself.
I think that`s the best shoujo I`ve ever seen with Gekkan Shoujo Nozaki-kun.
fantastic!!!
Masterpiece. Want to watch again
Top notch comedy!
enjoying this right away!
I hope that male viewers won`t be scared off by the overdose of pink and frills. This is a sugar-coated gem!

what a shame that it isn`t rated 9, this show is absolutely among the best anime Japan has ever/will ever produce. animation is solid, plot is good, many funny twists and turnovers, overall this show is absolutely amazing 9/10 for me
Funny..... very funny anime.... a must see not just for gals out there but also for boys who wants to laugh
Awesome anime; has a good sense of humor and is also very original. ^^;
This anime is witty, cute and so funny that I laughed forever. I`ve watched this over and over again, cause I simple love it! ^__^ The voiceacting is awesome too.
Just...so great
great anime, very funny
I wasn`t very enthusiast about it at first, but it blew away my expectations.

I started watching it because of a friend who said it was funny. I didn`t quite get the jokes until I got to meet the characters =D and I LOVE IT! ^^ Not only is it fun, but also makes you think about the "value" or "abilities" each different person has...

All Right, maybe it is made for girls... but who cares! Any anime fan should watch it. The jokes are truly funny and the way writers used stereotypes is just awesome. Boy or girl, you must give it a chance. _____________ Tudo bem, pode até ser feito pra garotas, mas e daí!?Todo fã de anime deve assistir. Não só a série é engraçada sozinha mas a forma como os autores conseguem brincar com os clichês é sensacional! Menino ou menina, assista!

This anime was probably made for girls, but I know a lot of guys who are against shojo animes to fall for the humor in it. I find this anime to be a "must see" because it is more or less parody of anime harem anime; it`s light and easy to watch, and very funny.

Probably the best romance comedy I`ve ever seen, maybe even because of the heroine is (thank God!) not the typical naive girl that only cries and blushes all the time, which makes her really attractive. Definitely must see :)
I`m re-watching this right now. I had forgotten how good it is! You should watch it.

In my top 3 list of best romantic comedies. It is a perfect example of a rare type of anime that does not rely on cliche jabs and perverse Ecchi for humor. That being said. It has an amazingly touching story and I was busting out laughing in almost every episode.
Extremely funny and very well made anime. Totally a must see. Tamaki senpai is so hilarious!! XD
Heartwarming story that could change your life with plucky, well-developed characters.

anime.description: Ouran High School is a school for the extremely wealthy or talented. http://anidb.net/ch713 [Haruhi] just happens to be more talented than wealthy. Since she had a hair mishap the week before school started and could not afford the school uniform, she was mistaken for a boy. Wandering into the Third Music Room looking for a quiet place to study, she encounters the school`s Host Club — a group of attractive young men who give their time and affections to females, for a fee. After she breaks an ¥8,000,000 vase belonging to the host club, the leader demands that she work off the money by becoming a host. And when they find out Haruhi is not actually a boy, humour ensues.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: trap
tag.description: A trap is a plot device where a male character is mistaken for a female, with the intention of sexually deceiving other characters and/or the viewer. This behavior does not need to be intentional by the male (it is often not intentional) or continually maintained by the male, but the occurrence is common enough to deserve this fetish-specific tag. This is often achieved by portraying the male character as a female; primarily via their clothing and physical appearance, but also through his behaviour, and/or language. A male character misinterpreted by others as female, without action from the male (explicitly feminine dress or behaviour), is generally not considered a trap; instead they are likely just http://anidb.net/t2561 [androgynous]. The reverse case is known as a http://anidb.net/t1637 [reverse trap]. Note: the tag image is from http://anidb.net/a10475 [Himegoto].

tag.name: moe
tag.description: Moe is a Japanese slang loanword that refers to feelings of strong affection mainly towards characters in anime, manga, and video games. Moe, however, has also gained usage to refer to feelings of affection towards any subject. Moe can be related to lust; however, pure lust without other feelings is considered outside its scope. The word Moe originated in the late 1980s and early 1990s in Japan and is of uncertain origin, although there are several theories on how it came into use. At the anime level, the http://anidb.net/t7146 [cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] tag may also apply. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: reverse trap
tag.description: A reverse trap is a plot device where a female character is mistaken for a male, with the intention of sexually deceiving other characters and/or the viewer. This behavior does not need to be intentional by the female (it is often not intentional) or continually maintained by the female, but the occurrence is common enough to deserve this fetish-specific tag. This is often achieved by portraying the female character as a male; primarily via their clothing and physical appearance, but also through her behaviour, and/or language. A female character misinterpreted by others as male, without action from the female (explicitly masculine dress or behaviour), is generally not considered a reverse trap; instead they are likely just http://anidb.net/t2561 [androgynous]. The reverse case is known as a http://anidb.net/t618 [trap].

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: cosplaying
tag.description: This character likes to cosplay.

tag.name: cross-dressing
tag.description: This character sometimes wears clothes traditionally worn by and associated with the opposite sex. Cross-dressers often hide their cross-dressing identity for a long period of time and thus tend to become adept in accurately portraying the opposite sex in terms of voice, movement, behaviour, temperament, etc.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: medium awareness
tag.description: Medium awareness is the situational and generally temporary awareness characters in works of fiction have and display of the very fact that they are characters in works of fiction. For example, they may comment about the background music, quip about the script or narration, complain about the roles given to them by the writer or their lack of screen time, see the subtitles that appear on screen, inform the audience about the arrival of the commercial break, and even use medium effects as tools. The most common form of medium awareness is known as breaking the fourth wall, in which characters speak directly to the audience, either to it as a whole or to specific members of it. The "fourth wall" is the imaginary "wall" at the front of the stage of a proscenium theatre through which the audience sees the play; it is a metaphor for the boundary between what happens inside the work, to the characters, and outside it, to the audience.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: satire
tag.description: In satire, vices, follies, abuses, and shortcomings are held up to ridicule, ideally with the intent of shaming individuals, and society itself, into improvement. Although satire is usually meant to be funny, its greater purpose is often constructive social criticism, using wit as a weapon. (Wikipedia)

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: school festival - TO BE SPLIT AND DELETED
tag.description: THIS TAG NEEDS TO BE SPLIT: into http://anidb.net/perl-bin/animedb.pl?show=tag&tagid=6119&reltb=eptb [school culture festival] and http://anidb.net/perl-bin/animedb.pl?show=tag&tagid=2665&reltb=eptb [school sports festival] The obligatory school festival (or cultural fair) with cosplay cafe, haunted house, theatre performance, and food booths cannot be missing in any school setting. For good measure there may also be an athletics or sports festival in this anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: first kiss
tag.description: The first kiss plays a role in this anime. Especially for the female cast this can be quite an important moment, so that stealing ones first kiss is serious for them.

tag.name: shounen ai
tag.description: Shounen Ai means boys love, and thus explores what happens when two boys (or men) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2723 [Yaoi] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphical sex. The female version is http://anidb.net/t2782 [Shoujo Ai].

tag.name: sudden girlfriend appearance
tag.description: Sudden Girlfriend Appearance anime involve a sudden change in the main character`s life where (s)he suddenly gets confronted with an individual (s)he`s sexually attracted to, the two of them inevitably becoming a couple.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: reverse harem
tag.description: Reverse harem, or sometimes also male harem, is the common name for the gender-reversed version of the usual http://anidb.net/t2859 [harem genre]. In a reverse harem, instead of the usual situation with several female characters focused on one male character, the viewer sees several male characters surrounding a single female character. Aside from the swapping of the characters` genders, the trope`s details are mostly the same, with the majority of the changes relating to the differences in behavior between men and women of the characters` age range. The most notable exception is that, due to the most relevant characteristics of the trope`s fan base, reverse harem authors tend to go for http://anidb.net/t1760 [bishounen] looks. Though they are also exceptions to the common harem genre, harems with homosexual relationships are not covered by reverse harem.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: mafia
tag.description: A mafia is a type of organized crime syndicate whose primary activities are protection racketeering, the arbitration of disputes between criminals, and the organizing and oversight of illegal agreements and transactions. Secondary activities may be practiced such as gambling, drug trafficking, loan sharking, and fraud. The term was originally applied to the Sicilian mafia, but has since expanded to encompass other organizations of similar methods and purpose, such as in "the Russian mafia" or "the Japanese mafia", and is applied informally by the press and public, but the criminal organizations themselves have their own terms; for example, the original Sicilian and Italian-American mafia call themselves "cosa nostra", while the Japanese mafia calls itself "yakuza". Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: unfoundedly feared character
tag.description: Due to some strange misunderstanding, or some other unfounded reason the character in the anime is feared by his contemporaries. Example: A male student with an "evil eye" is mistaken for a delinquent, and thus feared by the students in his class.

tag.name: open-ended
tag.description: The ending of this anime is left to the viewer`s imagination. There are no clear hints at a definite story outcome, several possibilities are presented without closure, or the story ends suddenly without explanation. There may also be room for a sequel.

tag.name: adoring fan club
tag.description: A character, group or characters, or an organisation is considered so awesome that a adoring fan club is formed to idolise them. Not only do they have notable admirers, but their fans become organised in such a fashion to have a following that could only be guaranteed in real life by precise and long increments of paparazzi-like stalking. If the character is sufficiently cool, an instant fan club may happen practically overnight (i.e., within a few episodes of them being introduced), although the subject of admiration typically has mixed feelings about the entire affair.

tag.name: test of courage
tag.description: As part of a summer excursion or festival, an anime with school setting may also have a test of courage (or kimodameshi in Japanese), where the male and female students are paired up (by lottery) to retrieve a "charm" by passing though a "haunted house" or a scary forest at night. The teachers usually disguise themselves as monsters or ghosts, scaring the students out of their socks. This seems to be some sort of Japanese "coming of age" ritual, providing a certain level of excitement under controlled and safe circumstances. Frequently seen in the Festival Episode.

tag.name: banana peel
tag.description: Used as slapstick comedy element in this anime: At least one of the characters in this anime will slip on a banana peel, leading to humorous or even ecchi situations.

tag.name: dear mother in heaven
tag.description: A form of veneration of ancestors, where people call upon their ancestors for help, advice and similar in their everyday life like in other cultures upon God, Jesus, the Virgin Mary or various saints. The veneration of the spirit`s of one`s ancestors is an integral part of Japanese culture.

tag.name: grandiose displays of wealth
tag.description: Some of the characters in this anime come from very wealthy families. A huge estate with large mansion or castle, a flotilla of expensive cars, private jets or islands, and many servants will impress the viewer profoundly.

tag.name: dialogue driven
tag.description: A dialogue driven show has its story advanced by dialogue, with action being of much lower priority, and relies heavily on conversations between characters.

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: adapted into JDrama
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a JDrama. A JDrama (Japanese drama), also called "terebi dorama" ("television drama") or "dorama" for short, is a Japanese live action television series. Japan produces many drama series every year, from a huge variety of genres. Like anime, they generally air in three-month seasons or multiples thereof, with new shows airing every season. Some kinds of drama, especially the morning or afternoon ones, tend to be broadcast daily, while evening ones tend to be broadcast weekly, also like anime. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: spacing out
tag.description: A comedy element: The character starts to daydream or fantasize about some topic. The typical complete lack of reality makes the spacing out funny. Especially when the protagonist mumbles to himself / herself and friends hear this. Promptly teasing the possibly lovestruck and very embarrassed protagonist.

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: self-parody
tag.description: The anime is a parody of itself. I.e. the authors make fun of the genre they are portraying, and take the actions of their characters and story lightly.

tag.name: creepy laugh
tag.description: At least one character in the show inexplicably and repetitively seems to have the urgent need to laugh in a creepy, loud and usually very annoying way. For male bad guys this seems to be a must, but some of the uppity (rich) female characters use the laugh as part of their condescending attitude as well.

tag.name: poverty
tag.description: It refers to the condition of not having the means to afford basic human needs.

tag.name: high-class world
tag.description: Some of the characters in this anime live in a "high-class world". Usually this means that, they are rich and/or quite influential.

tag.name: family without mother
tag.description: For some reason, the protagonist`s mother is no longer among the living. The much-too-early death was due to sickness or accident. This plot device adds a certain degree of tragedy to the anime, and usually has repercussions on the rest of the family. For example: the grief-stricken father and children barely function as humans; the oldest daughter has an extra burden of raising the other children, additional emphasis is given to the only female child in the family, i.e. with bishounen brother and dad in a shoujo setting. In rare cases the mother may still be alive, just not living with the rest of the family presently, i.e. on some quest or job and gone for a long time.

tag.name: beach visit
tag.description: Every anime has to have them, episodes in which the characters for whatever reason end up going to the sea, ocean, random island or the local pond. Usually used for fanservice purpose as it gives the staff the opportunity to draw the characters in swimsuits and raise the DVD sales. The cheap version is the http://anidb.net/t6046 [pool episode]. Other marginally less used variants of this are the http://anidb.net/t3444 [onsen episode] and the http://anidb.net/t2830 [furo scene], used when it is too cold for a beach/pool episode. See also http://anidb.net/t2830 [furo scene].

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: gender bender
tag.description: Term used to refer to a person who takes on the role of their opposite gender. This often only reaches to the extent of cross-dressing (involving physical appearance and clothing only), but in rarer cases, involves a total gender swap (which seems to be more common in anime) - where the willing or unwilling victim receives a body opposite of their original gender (either permanently or temporarily), with all natural parts per their new body fully (or just all-out amply) included. Example of cross-dressing gender bender: "Maria+Holic" Examples of body-swap gender bender: "Kashimashi: Girl meets Girl", "Birdy the Mighty Decode"

tag.name: pool episode
tag.description: An episode playing at the pool, mostly in school, sometimes outside of it when the cast does not have a chance for a beach episode. Usually used for fanservice purpose as it gives the staff the opportunity to draw the characters in swimsuits and raise the DVD sales. The cheap version of the http://anidb.net/t5846 [beach episode]. Other variants are the http://anidb.net/t3444 [onsen episode] and the http://anidb.net/t2830 [furo scene], used when it is too cold for a beach/pool episode. See also http://anidb.net/t2830 [furo scene].

tag.name: physical examination
tag.description: A comedy element with ecchi potential in your typical school setting: The (especially female) cast is measured for weight, height and other measurements by the school’s nurse. The female cast may then be upset about the lack of “development” in certain areas, or shocked about a perceived weight gain. The male cast on the other hand will try to “sneak a peek”.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: character related tags which need deleting or merging
tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: adapted into Japanese movie
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a Japanese movie. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Suou Tamaki
character.description: The president of the Host club and the Prince type. He is extremely passionate and kind, always ready to help people, and has an interest in many things. He is considered the most attractive of the hosts, very intelligent (2nd in his class behind Kyoya), and a gifted piano player. He is very sincere in what he says, and takes his role to please girls very seriously, which stems from his deep love of his mother. However, the other club members recognize him as an idiot most of the time because he is very dense about his own situations (though perceptive about others), very silly and melodramatic at times, and somewhat selfish and narcissistic. He also has an odd obsession for the "commoner`s lifestyle" and loves ramen and instant coffee (considered "commoner food"). He considers the Host Club to be a family and named himself father and Kyoya as the mother. His father is the superintendent of Ouran High School and his family is one of the wealthiest in Japan. His mother was forced to leave him so he would hopefully one day be recognized as the heir of the Suoh family by his grandmother, who does not like him. Tamaki is half-French and half-Japanese. He later discovers he possesses feelings for Haruhi that he is unable to decipher, still thinking them as family.

character.name: Fujioka Haruhi
character.description: Haruhi Fujioka is the main character of the series. She is an intelligent but poor first-year student attending exclusive Ouran High School on a special scholarship that requires her rank first in her class. One day, while looking for a quiet place to study, she stumbles upon the Ouran Host Club and accidentally breaks an expensive vase belonging to the famed Host Club and must work off her debt as a host for them; to do this, she must disguise herself as a boy, which she finds easy to do because she does not feel that her gender dominates her personality. She soon realizes she enjoys acting as a host to other girls, which she takes to naturally, though she does not like taking time away from studying and finds the antics of the other hosts extremely irritating. Although habitually quiet and unflappable, she has a deep fear of thunderstorms. Haruhi lives with her okama (crossdressing) father and has become skilled in household chores due to her mother`s death when she was 6. Although her independent, straight-forward personality clashes with those of the other, more outgoing hosts, Haruhi becomes friends with them, especially the Hitachiin twins, who are in her class, a fact that is exceedingly troublesome to the Host Club King, Tamaki.

character.name: Ootori Kyouya
character.description: Kyoya Ootori is a second-year student at Ouran High School and the cunning and sly vice-president of the Host Club. Kyoya is best friends with Tamaki, despite their completely different demeanors. Tamaki tends to call him "Mom", or "Mother", in reference to Tamaki calling himself "Daddy". Kyoya is secretive and intelligent, being able to calculate any benefits that would come out of the Host Club`s misadventures. Despite having quite antagonistic traits, the Host Club wouldn`t be as half as successful without Kyoya`s uptight resourcefulness. Although he doesn`t put an act for the women, he is considered the "cool type." He lives with his father, an affluent zaibatsu owner specializing in hospital management, two brothers that he has to surpass to become his father`s successor, and an older sister who deeply cares about him.

character.name: Hitachiin Hikaru
character.description: Hikaru Hitachiin and Kaoru Hitachiin are first-year students at Ouran High School. They are depicted as mischievous, devious, and otherwise childish young men who often toy with fellow classmate and Host Club member, Haruhi. However, as they get to know her better, they start to care for her deeply, especially since they discovered that Haruhi can tell them apart even when they mess up their hair (the easiest way to tell them apart is the way they part their hair), something that no one has ever done before. When they were very young, a maid they were close to betrayed them, and when they asked her if she could play the "Which one is Hikaru?" game, she denied, telling them instead that no one would ever be able to tell them apart. They believed that no one could possibly win the game, and that no one cared about them enough to really try. Tamaki Suoh, however, in their last year of middle school, repeatedly followed them, tossing out random guesses as to who was Hikaru and who was Kaoru to get them to join the Host Club, citing his intuition each time. Finally they crumbled, and decided to just try out the Host Club, and thus took a step towards a wider world, also developing a deep bond with Tamaki. For this reason, they were originally cynical to the world before joining the Host Club, believing that anyone who is not the other twin cannot possibly compare to their bond. Additionally, because their parents were often away, they developed a deep dependence on each other through loneliness, but seem to open up to others recently, thus their relationship with Haruhi is a large part of their life. The Hitachiin twins show many instances of "brotherly love" (or twincest, as later mentioned in the manga) which gets girls to fall for them left and right. They are the little devil type to attract customers. However, they do have their differences. Kaoru is nicer, more mature, and considerate to the thoughts of others, while Hikaru is more childish and immature, although Hikaru is the older. Kaoru also chooses not to go after his feelings for Haruhi so that Hikaru can realize his own feelings first. The personality differences are only shown when they are separated, and there is a slight difference in the way they talk. They live with their mother, Yuzuha, a fashion designer, and their considerably meeker father, a computer software designer.

character.name: Hitachiin Kaoru
character.description: Hikaru Hitachiin and Kaoru Hitachiin are first-year students at Ouran High School. They are depicted as mischievous, devious, and otherwise childish young men who often toy with fellow classmate and Host Club member, Haruhi. However, as they get to know her better, they start to care for her deeply, especially since they discovered that Haruhi can tell them apart even when they mess up their hair (the easiest way to tell them apart is the way they part their hair), something that no one has ever done before. When they were very young, a maid they were close to betrayed them, and when they asked her if she could play the "Which one is Hikaru?" game, she denied, telling them instead that no one would ever be able to tell them apart. They believed that no one could possibly win the game, and that no one cared about them enough to really try. Tamaki Suoh, however, in their last year of middle school, repeatedly followed them, tossing out random guesses as to who was Hikaru and who was Kaoru to get them to join the Host Club, citing his intuition each time. Finally they crumbled, and decided to just try out the Host Club, and thus took a step towards a wider world, also developing a deep bond with Tamaki. For this reason, they were originally cynical to the world before joining the Host Club, believing that anyone who is not the other twin cannot possibly compare to their bond. Additionally, because their parents were often away, they developed a deep dependence on each other through loneliness, but seem to open up to others recently, thus their relationship with Haruhi is a large part of their life. The Hitachiin twins show many instances of "brotherly love" (or twincest, as later mentioned in the manga) which gets girls to fall for them left and right. They are the little devil type to attract customers. However, they do have their differences. Kaoru is nicer, more mature, and considerate to the thoughts of others, while Hikaru is more childish and immature, although Hikaru is the older. Kaoru also chooses not to go after his feelings for Haruhi so that Hikaru can realize his own feelings first. The personality differences are only shown when they are separated, and there is a slight difference in the way they talk. They live with their mother, Yuzuha, a fashion designer, and their considerably meeker father, a computer software designer.

character.name: Haninozuka Mitsukuni
character.description: Mitsukuni Haninozuka, usually called Honey, is a third-year at Ouran High School depicted as a very childish and cake-loving boy who is much older than his elementary school appearance would indicate. In the anime, there is a scene which shows the true strength and power Honey possesses and it is said that he has been told by Japan`s Defence Minister not to show his full power for fear of other countries thinking Japan held a weapon of mass destruction, causing the other countries to fire missiles at Japan (see episode 18 in the anime). Hunny is often around his cousin, Mori, who is very close to him. Honey lives with his father, the owner of a famous dojo and his little brother, Yasuchika, with whom he is often at odds. Hunny is very fond of eating sweets and his room is full of stuffed animals. He always carries around a plush bunny named Bun-Bun. He used to hide his true self (with much difficulty) by being a "real man" for some time, but after Tamaki convinced him that liking cute things wasn`t bad, he soon realised that there was absolutely no need for him to do that. Then, together with Mori, he joined the host club, attracting customers with his shotacon cuteness.

character.name: Morinozuka Takashi
character.description: Takashi Morinozuka, usually called Mori, is a third-year at Ouran High School. Mori is depicted as tall, quiet and somewhat intimidating, but he is very protective of Hunny (who he calls by his first name, Mitsukuni, and vice versa). It was seen in the anime and manga where Hunny had a toothache. Mori blamed himself for not reminding Hunny to brush his teeth. He then restricted Hunny from eating candy until he had a filling for his cavity. Hunny ended up judo-throwing Mori to the floor in a fit of anger, but they made up soon afterwards. The Morinozuka family had protected and served the Haninozuka family for many generations. As the two families were joined by marriage two generations back, the families became related to each other, thus breaking the master-servant tradition. Nevertheless, Mori still faithfully protects Hunny and is always by his side, attending to his wishes and watching out for him; his protective personality extends to his classmates and the host club members, resulting in his gaining a certain level of respect. Although as a host, he is considered the "wild" type (changed to the strong, silent type in the dub, most likely to make it less confusing as it`s not explained why he`s the wild type), he normally doesn`t try to woo girls. The girls like how he cares for Hunny, and shyer customers are attracted to his tall physique and taciturn personality. Mori`s hobbies include kendo, of which he is the national champion.

character.name: Kisaragi Quon
character.description: Quon Kisaragi is a mysterious young girl who speaks the first words of the TV series and is shown meeting Ayato in episode 4. Her standard expression of surprise or agreement is "La-la" and most of her dialogue is cryptic and musically themed. She and Ayato do not connect romantically, but she displays a level of both physical and interpersonal comfort and intimacy with Ayato that is unmatched by any of the other characters, even Haruka. She is also one of the few people who never treats Ayato as a curiosity or an annoyance, and she seems to have an understanding of his situation and what his eventual role is, calling him "Orin".

character.name: Houshakuji Renge
character.description: The Host Club`s (self-proclaimed) manager who tends to be very loud and outspoken. She had lived in France for a short time before she came to attend Ouran. Renge first came across the Host Club by maintaining the belief she was Kyouya`s fiancée despite never having met him in person. This is due to her love of visual novel-type video games to a point that she sometimes confuses them with real life. Her fascination with Kyouya originated from her obsession with one such dating game (Kyouya greatly resembled the lead character). Still, her experience with dating sims causes her to be more aware of character development and a thickening plot.

character.name: Kamigamo Tsubaki
character.description: A regular Host Club customer of Tamaki.

character.name: Sakurazaka Kimiko
character.description: A regular Host Club customer. She is a first year in class A and a fan of Haruhi.

character.name: Kurakano Momoka
character.description: A regular Host Club customer. She is a first year in class A and is class vice chairman. She has excellent grades and is a fan of Haruhi.

character.name: Nekozawa Umehito
character.description: Depicted as a hooded figure holding a cat puppet named Beelzenef, Umehito hates bright light to the point that he refers to anyone who drags him into lights as "murderers". The Black Magic Club`s president, he tries to get people to join his club though is not too successful. However, anyone who joins gets a free "Beelzenef" doll. Umehito has one as a puppet, but it is also available as a voodoo doll. Nekozawa claims that if you write the name of the person you hate on the back of the doll, the person will be showered with misfortunes. Tamaki, especially, is superstitious about Nekozawa`s curses due to having experienced them first-hand, or so he believes.

character.name: Fujioka Ryouji
character.description: Haruhi`s father, works at an okama (cross dressing) bar under the name Ranka. He says that he was originally bisexual, but became homosexual after his wife`s death because he could never love another woman. In contrast to Haruhi`s practicality and lack of interest in material things, he is rather bad with money, and buys girly clothing for Haruhi in the hopes of getting her to dress more cutely.

character.name: Nekozawa Kirimi
character.description: Nekozawa-senpai`s little sister.

character.name: Karasuma Ruri
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Kimiwada Honoka
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Kitamikado Kozue
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Usami Haruna
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Ebisugawa Shiori
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Mikamo Matsurika
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Munakata Ayumi
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Suwaki Azusa
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Aika Yuriko
character.description: A regular Host Club customer.

character.name: Amakusa Benio
character.description: A student of Saint Lobelia Girls Academy, and the head of the White Lily Society, nicknamed the Zuka Club. ("Zuka" is an abbreviation of the Takarazuka Revue, a Japanese all-female musical theater troupe from the Hyougo prefecture.) They frequently perform stage productions, and make money by selling various club-related goods. They want to "rescue" Haruhi from the Host Club and attempt to convince her to come to Lobelia, but Haruhi refuses. Later, however, they do kidnap Haruhi and guilt trip her into performing in one of their stage productions. Benio`s nickname is Benibara, or Red Rose. She notices that Haruhi is a woman at first glance. She is the star of Lobelia.

character.name: Maihara Chizuru
character.description: A student of Saint Lobelia Girls Academy, and vice manager of the White Lily Society, nicknamed the Zuka Club. ("Zuka" is an abbreviation of the Takarazuka Revue, a Japanese all-female musical theater troupe from the Hyougo prefecture.) They frequently perform stage productions, and make money by selling various club-related goods. They want to "rescue" Haruhi from the Host Club and attempt to convince her to come to Lobelia, but Haruhi refuses. Later, however, they do kidnap Haruhi and guilt trip her into performing in one of their stage productions. Chizuru`s nickname is Suzuran, or Lily of the Valley.

character.name: Tsuwabuki Hinako
character.description: A student of Saint Lobelia Girls Academy, and a member of the White Lily Society, nicknamed the Zuka Club. ("Zuka" is an abbreviation of the Takarazuka Revue, a Japanese all-female musical theater troupe from the Hyougo prefecture.) They frequently perform stage productions, and make money by selling various club-related goods. They want to "rescue" Haruhi from the Host Club and attempt to convince her to come to Lobelia, but Haruhi refuses. Later, however, they do kidnap Haruhi and guilt trip her into performing in one of their stage productions. Hinako`s nickname is Hinagiku, or Daisy.

character.name: Fujioka Kotoko
character.description: Fujioka Kotoko was Haruhi`s mother, who died when her daughter was still very young. Haruhi remarks in the first episode that it has been ten years since her mother died, which makes her about five years old at that time. She was an attorney at law; Haruhi takes after her in some ways and she remains Haruhi`s role-model. If the way in which Haruhi recalls her in her memories and dreams is accurate, she was a dedicated and loving mother who wished the best for her family. One can assume she was also open-minded to live with and love her husband, "Ranka". He states that Kotoko was both beautiful and intelligent and reveals that she was a closet fan of the St. Lobelia`s Zuka Club of her day. In later chapters, it is shown that she was popular at her law school and, in a recent omake, that she found Ryoji to be strange and annoying, but all the same liked him from the first moment they met.

character.name: Suou Yuzuru
character.description: Suou Yuzuru is the patriarch of the Suou family and chairman of Ouran Academy. He is the 48 year old father of Tamaki and his hobbies are golf, theater and teasing his son. Yuzuru shares some of his son`s characteristics. Despite knowing of his mother`s loathing of Tamaki, he can do little to help the situation. To date, his only act of rebellion against his mother`s wishes seems to be not breaking off his relationship with Tamaki`s mother, instead divorcing the woman his mother had chosen for him. In the anime, he appears to be cold to Tamaki, though this might be to show that he does not favor his son as a student, as a scene in the anime shows photographs of Tamaki at different stages of life on his office desk. It also seems Tamaki gained his charms from his father. Tamaki is very serious in Yuzuru`s presence, but the manga is a little different, showing Yuzuru as eager to tease his son at every opportunity, sending him red herrings in the middle of an investigation and telling tall tales.

character.name: Ootori Takao
character.description: Ootori Takao, Kyouya`s father, is the patriarch of the Ootori family. Takao is portrayed as a cold, calculating father. Kyouya tries hard to please him to become heir of the family, despite the fact that his father apparently shows no understanding for his children and has planned out the lives of his sons as his successors already. In the manga, he acknowledges Kyouya as a possible successor despite being the third son. In the anime, he states he has already decided Kyouya would inherit Ootori Medical from him (in the manga, he states it is a possibility), only to have his third son buy it and return it to his control without ever revealing his identity. He wants Kyouya to marry Haruhi in the anime. Source: wiki

character.name: Ootori Fuyumi
character.description: Ootori Fuyumi is Kyouya`s older sister. In the anime, she appears during Kyouya`s flashbacks about his first meeting with Tamaki. She clearly cares for her younger brother and tries to help him in life. She is somewhat lacking in the areas of housework and organization as any time she tries to help Kyouya packing clothes they ends up all over the place literally, but appears to be a kind-hearted person. The manga reveals that she is married, but returned home for a short visit. Her husband`s surname is Shido (矢道). She and Tamaki are pursuing a tour of commoners` food together.

character.name: Sonoda Misuzu
character.description: Sonoda Misuzu is Ranka`s colleague at the cross dressing bar. He runs a pension in Karuizawa, Nagano, where Haruhi works during summer vacation. He holds a contest among the hosts over who will be the most refreshing and able to stay at the pension; he is swayed by Kaoru and Hikaru after a display of "brotherly love" earns them "100 refreshing points". His real name is Isao. He was formerly a banker and has a love for making frilly Lolita-type clothing.

character.name: Eclair
character.description: An anime-only character. Éclair is the beautiful and shrewd heir to the France-based Grand Tonnerre Group, which in the anime employs Tamaki`s mother as a servant in Éclair`s house. Having heard a great deal about Tamaki from his mother, Éclair develops a crush on him and Tamaki`s grandmother, who detests his mother, concocts a scheme to make him Éclair`s husband. She tracks down Tamaki in Japan and convinces him to leave the Host Club, offering him a chance to see his mother if he complies with her wishes. She secures noninterference from the Ootori group by arranging for the Grand Tonnerre Group to buy Ootori Medical so as to control Kyoya`s father.

character.name: Haninozuka Yasuchika
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch717 [Mitsukuni "Honey" Haninozuka]`s younger brother, whom Honey calls "Chika". He often feels overshadowed by his older brother and has grown a lasting resentment towards him for enjoying things that are cute and dropping out as the Karate Club`s President. He is also very astonished by the amount of cake he eats in one night and how quickly he does so. His greatest ambition is to one day finally defeat his brother in combat, but in the end Honey easily defeats him, choosing the things he loves most over his brother`s feelings, much to Mori`s surprise. Yasuchika`s best friend is Satoshi Morinozuka, the younger brother of Mori. Both seem to be polar opposites of their older brothers, however, it is shown that underneath Chika`s attitude, he is much like Honey, crying easily and collecting cute stuffed toy chicks and chick photo books. He goes to seventh grade while his older brother is at Ouran Academy.

character.name: Souga Kazukiyo
character.description: Souga Kazukiyo is the Class President of 1-A, who suffers from nyctophobia (severe fear of the dark) and a fear of just about anything that is scary. He has romantic feelings for Class 1-A`s Vice-President Momoka, whom he has known for years, but he is initially too shy to say anything. Hikaru and Kaoru comment that he is the kind of person with pure feelings who they cannot tease, possibly because he is more emotionally vulnerable than Tamaki. In the manga, he unwittingly caused Haruhi trouble with her scholarship when he ranked as the top student of his grade.

character.name: Ayanokouji
character.description: Member of 3-A class. An Ex-Host club regular. Her first name is unknown. She is a sarcastic princess type that brags about her upper class. Jealous of Haruhi about Tamaki`s attention to her.

character.name: Kasugazaki Kanako
character.description: Member of 2-B class. She is Ex-Regular of Host club. Often changed her Hosts.

character.name: Suzushima Tooru
character.description: Heir of Suzushima company which trades antique tea cups.

character.name: Yabu
character.description: A doctor which came to Ouran High School to look for his daughter.

character.name: Takaouji Shirou
character.description: Elementary school boy who wants to be apprentice of Tamaki.

character.name: Kamishiro Hina
character.description: Elementary school girl.

character.name: Maezono Shima
character.description: Head of Servants at second Suou`s household.

character.name: Ouya
character.description: Landlord of house where Haruhi lives.

character.name: Kuretake
character.description: Nekozawa family maid.

character.name: Kadomatsu
character.description: Nekozawa family secretary.

character.name: Haruhi
character.description: Haruhi in Wonderland.

character.name: Boushiya
character.description: Tamaki in Wonderland.

character.name: Imomushi
character.description: Kyouya in Wonderland.

character.name: Cheshire Neko A
character.description: Hikaru in Wonderland.

character.name: Cheshire Neko B
character.description: Kaoru in Wonderland.

character.name: Sangatsu Usagi
character.description: Honey-kun in Wonderland.

character.name: Nemuri Nezumi
character.description: Takashi in Wonderland.

character.name: Koushaku-fujin
character.description: Renge in Wonderland.

character.name: Hearts no Ou
character.description: Haruhi`s father Fujioka Ryouji in Wonderland.

character.name: Hearts no Joou
character.description: Haruhi`s mother Fujioka Kotoko in Wonderland.

character.name: Ryouri Onna
character.description: Ayanokouji in Wonderland.

character.name: Nezumi
character.description: Takaouji Shirou in Wonderland.

character.name: Dodo Tori
character.description: Kasugazaki Kanako in Wonderland.

character.name: Tonji
character.description: Nekozawa Umehito in Wonderland.

character.name: Tonji no Imouto
character.description: Nekozawa Kirimi in Wonderland.

character.name: Komatsuzawa Akira
character.description: Newspaper club president. Third year.

character.name: Ukyou Chikage
character.description: Newspaper club member. Second year.

character.name: Sakyou Tomochika
character.description: Newspaper club member. Second year.

character.name: Arai
character.description: Junior high school classmate of Haruhi.

character.name: Gofujin
character.description: Chairwoman of a major electronics manufacturer. Kyouya with Haruhi meet her in the department store when the pottery seller tried to trick her.

character.name: Touki Uri
character.description: Pottery seller from department store.

character.name: Fast-Food Ten no Ten`in
character.description: Fast-Food staff.

character.name: Haninozuka Yorihisa
character.description: Mitsukuni`s father. It is said that he is greatest genius to appear in the Haninozuka house since its inception.

character.name: Hitachiin Ka no Sewagakari
character.description: Hitachiin governess.

character.name: Kasanoda Ritsu
character.description: Member of 1-D class. Most of the people in the school are feared by his scary eyes.

character.name: Sendou Tetsuya
character.description: Sendou Tetsuya run away from his family and is now member of Kasanoda house.

character.name: Tamaki no Sobo
character.description: Tamaki`s grandmother.

episode.title: 今日から君はホストだ
Starting Today, You Are a Host!
Von heute an bist du ein Host
A partir d`aujourd`hui, tu es un hôte !
ตั้งแต่วันนี้ไป นายจงเป็นโฮสต์ซะ
Kyou kara Kimi wa Host Da
episode.summary: After Haruhi literally stumbles in on the Ouran Host Club and breaks an expensive vase, she discovers there’s only one way she’ll ever be able to pay for the damage - working as a Host! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 高校生ホストのお仕事
The Job of a High School Host!
Die Arbeit eines Oberschüler Hosts
Le travail d`un hôte
งานของโฮสต์คลับ ม.ปลาย
Koukousei Host no Oshigoto
episode.summary: Haruhi’s fickle client seems to have a new favorite Host every week. With a formal party right around the corner, Tamaki masterminds a scheme to help her settle down with the right guy once and for all. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 身体検査に御用心
Beware the Physical Exam!
Vorsicht vor der ärztlichen Untersuchung
Attention à la visite médicale
ะวังการตรวจร่างกายเอาไว้ให้ดี
Shintai Kensa ni Goyoujin
episode.summary: With Ouran Academy’s physical exam threatening to expose Haruhi’s secret, Tamaki is forced to utilize some diversionary tactics. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 女子マネージャー襲来
Attack of the Lady Manager!
Überfall eines weiblichen Managers
L`invasion de la manager
การจู่โจมของผู้จัดการหญิง
Joshi Manager Shuurai
episode.summary: Renge, an intense young woman obsessed with dating sims, declares herself the Host Club’s new manager! Her first order of business: give each of the Hosts a “dark side.” Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 双子ケンカする
The Twins Fight!
Die Zwillinge streiten sich
La dispute des jumeaux
คู่แฝดบาดหมาง
Futago Kenka Suru
episode.summary: When Haruhi divulges the secret of how she can tell Hikaru from Kaoru, their sibling rivalry quickly spirals out of control. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 小学生ホストはやんちゃ系
The Grade School Host Is the Naughty Type!
Der Grundschüler Host ist ein Frechdachs
Le style sale gosse
โฮสต์จอมซนวัยกระเตาะ
Shougakusei Host wa Yancha-kei
episode.summary: Tamaki takes an elementary school student as his apprentice, but the kid’s brutal honesty has everyone’s heads spinning! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジャングルプールSOS
Jungle Pool SOS!
Junge Pool SOS
SOS dans la piscine tropicale
จังเกิ้ลพูล SOS
Jungle Pool SOS
episode.summary: With Honey missing, the Hosts’ vacation turns into a search and rescue mission! But between alligator attacks and the onslaught of a private police force, who will save the rescuers? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太陽と海とホスト部
The Sun, the Sea, and the Host Club!
Sonne und Meer und Hosting Club
Le soleil, la mer et les hôtes
อาทิตย์ ทะเล และเหล่าโฮสต์
Taiyou to Umi to Host Bu
episode.summary: While at the beach, the twins make a game of finding ways to scare Haruhi! From haunted caves to beachside bullies, the newest member of the Host Club proves as fearless as they come. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ロベリア女学院の挑戦
A Challenge from Lobelia Girls` Academy!
Die Herausforderung der privaten Lobelia-Mädchenschule
Le défi de l`académie Lobelia !
การท้าทายจากโรงเรียนสตรีโลเบเลีย
Lobelia Jogakuin no Chousen
episode.summary: The Zuka Club drops in to check out the notorious Hosts - and they aren’t impressed. In fact, they have every intention of stealing Haruhi away from the boys. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 藤岡家の日常
A Day in the Life of the Fujioka Family!
Der Alltag der Familie Fujioka
La vie quotidienne des Fujioka
หนึ่งวันของบ้านฟูจิโอกะ
Fujioka-ke no Nichijou
episode.summary: Tamaki and the boys investigate Haruhi’s “aggregate commoner dwelling.” Though the apartment’s a tight fit, there’s more than enough room for the special kind of trouble that follows the Hosts around! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お兄ちゃまは王子様
Big Brother Is a Prince!
Oni-chama ist ein Prinz
Mon grand frère est un prince
คุณพี่คือเจ้าชาย
Onii-chama wa Ouji-sama
episode.summary: Nekozawa is famously sensitive to light and his baby sister is terrified of the dark. To bring them together, Renge sets out to reinvent gloomy Nekozawa into a dreamy prince! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハニー先輩の甘くない三日間
Honey`s Three Bitter Days!
Honey-Senpais unsüße drei Tage
Les trois jours amers de Hani
สามวันห้ามหวานของรุ่นพี่ฮันนี่
Honey-senpai no Amakunai Mikkakan
episode.summary: Mori makes Honey go sugar-free after the cutie gets a cavity, and it doesn’t take long for the littlest Host to turn against his friend! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不思議の国のハルヒ
Haruhi in Wonderland!
Haruhi im Wunderland
Haruhi au pays des merveilles
ฮารุฮิท่องแดนมหัศจรรย
Fushigi no Kuni no Haruhi
episode.summary: Haruhi finds herself wandering a weird version of Ouran Academy that can only be described as a Wonderland! Appropriately, Tamaki plays the part of the Mad Hatter. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 噂のホスト部を取材せよ
Covering the Famous Host Club!
Interviewe den berüchtigten Hostclub!
L`interview du célèbre club des hôtes
ตามล่าหาข่าวเหล่าโฮสต์คลับ
Uwasa no Host Bu o Shuzai Seyo
episode.summary: The Newspaper Club wants to run a story on the Hosts in order to boost readership. Unfortunately, the editor’s grudge against Tamaki could cause the guys to end up with some paper cuts. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 軽井沢さわやかバトル
The Refreshing Battle in Karuizawa!
Der erquickende Kampf in Karuizawa
Combat vivifiant à Karuizawa
ศึกแข่งสร้างความสดใสที่คารุอิซาว่า
Karuizawa Sawayaka Battle
episode.summary: The boys pay a visit to the bed and breakfast where Haruhi works part-time. But with just one room available, only the Host who can charm Haruhi’s boss the most will win a good night’s sleep! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハルヒと光の初デート大作戦
Operation Haruhi and Hikaru`s First Date!
Haruhi und Hikaru - der große Plan fürs erste Date
Un rendez-vous stratégique
แผนเดทแรกของฮารุฮิกับฮิคารุ
Haruhi to Hikaru no Hatsu Date Daisakusen
episode.summary: To teach his twin a lesson about relationships, Kaoru sends Hikaru and Haruhi on a little date. Hopefully, Hikaru can finally show everyone he’s capable of being thoughtful of others! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鏡夜の不本意な休日
Kyoya`s Reluctant Day Out!
Kyoyas ungewollter freier Tag
Kyôya en vacances malgré lui
วันหยุดที่ไม่เต็มใจของเคียวยะ
Kyouya no Fuhon`i na Kyuujitsu
episode.summary: Kyoya finds himself spending a day at a department store with Haruhi. He’s in a bad mood and completely out of his element, offering Haruhi a rare glimpse behind his polished demeanor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チカ君のハニー打倒宣言
Chika`s `Down with Honey` Declaration!
Chika-kuns Kampfansage an Honey
La déclaration de guerre de Chika
การประกาศโค่นฮันนี่ของจิกะคุง
Chika-kun no Honey Datou Sengen
episode.summary: The cutest little Host is a lethal fighting machine! Well, he used to be. Honey’s decision to abandon martial arts and pursue a life of luxury has his intense younger brother seething with rage! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ロベリア女学院の逆襲
Lobelia Girls` Academy Strikes Back!
Der Gegenangriff der Lobelia-Mädchenschule
Lobelia contre-attaque
การโต้กลับของโรงเรียนสตรีโลเบเลีย
Lobelia Jogakuin no Gyakushuu
episode.summary: The Hosts take action to rescue Haruhi after Benio manipulates her into taking the lead role in Lobelia’s extravagant musical production. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 双子があけた扉
The Door the Twins Opened!
Die Tür, die die Zwillinge aufstießen
La porte ouverte par les jumeaux
ประตูที่คู่แฝดเปิด
Futago ga Aketa Tobira
episode.summary: When Tamaki asked Hikaru and Kaoru to be inaugural members of the Host Club, they showed him just how difficult they could be. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いつかカボチャになる日まで
Until the Day It Becomes a Pumpkin!
Bis es wieder zu einem Kürbis wird
Jusqu`à ce qu`il devienne une citrouille
จนกว่าจะถึงวันที่กลายเป็นฟักทอง
Itsuka Kabocha ni Naru Hi made
episode.summary: Haruhi’s classmates hold a Halloween competition to find out who can be the most horrifying! Terror waits around every corner, but the fear in Kaoru’s heart has nothing to do with ghosts or ghouls. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 環の無自覚な憂鬱
Tamaki`s Unwitting Depression!
Tamakis unbewusste Melancholie
La mélancolie inconsciente de Tamaki
ความห่อเหี่ยวโดยไม่รู้ตัวของทามากิ
Tamaki no Mujikaku na Yuuutsu
episode.summary: Now that Kasanoda’s hooked on Haruhi, his constant presence in the music room is stirring some troubling emotions in the hearts of a few Hosts. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: モリ先輩に弟子入り志願
Mori-senpai Has an Apprentice Candidate!
Bewerbung als Lehrling bei Mori-Senpai
Mori acquiert un disciple
ขอสมัครเป็นลูกศิษย์รุ่นพี่โมริ
Mori-senpai ni Deshiiri Shigan
episode.summary: Bad boy Kasanoda’s hoping Mori can help him make some friends. After some time with the Hosts, the tough guy starts looking at things differently - and he’s looking at Haruhi in a whole new way, too! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: そして鏡夜は出会った
And So Kyoya Met Him!
Und Kyoya hatte eine Begegnung
Et Kyôya le rencontra
แล้วเคียวยะก็ได้พบ
Soshite Kyouya wa Deatta
episode.summary: Tamaki and Kyoya have built a solid - if unlikely - friendship by utilizing each other’s strengths, but there was a time when the two boys were more likely to strangle each other than team up to rule the school. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホスト部解散宣言
The Host Club Declares Dissolution!
Die Auflösung des Host-Clubs
L`annonce de la dissolution du club
ประกาศยุบชมรมโฮสต์
Host Bu Kaisan Sengen
episode.summary: Tamaki’s family brings a guest - Éclair - to the school festival, and she’s got designs on the King. Haruhi might be a tad jealous, but it’s Tamaki’s inner turmoil that presents the biggest threat to her happiness. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: これが俺たちの桜蘭祭
This Is Our Ouran Fair!
Das ist unser Ouran-Fest
Ce festival est notre fête
นี่คืองานโอรังของพวกเรา
Kore ga Ore-tachi no Ouransai
episode.summary: The only way to save the Host Club is to keep Tamaki from returning to France with Éclair! With the hopes of her dearest friends hanging in the balance, Haruhi makes her move! Source: crunchyroll
